headline: Governor DeWine sick with COVID-19, receiving treatment
author: Cynthia Rosi
sentences: DeWine has been experiencing mild symptoms such as a runny nose, head ache, body aches, and a sore throat, according to a media release from the governor’s office.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WCMH) — Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced on Friday afternoon that he has been diagnosed with COVID-19 by his personal physician.
DeWine and Mrs. DeWine are fully vaccinated, each having received the two-dose vaccination and a booster shot, the release concluded.
However, First Lady Fran DeWine is experiencing no symptoms and has tested negative, the media release said.
To follow CDC COVID-19 diagnosis protocol, he is in quarantine.
DeWine received a monoclonal antibody treatment.
